intro: Thyrsanthema ovalis, commonly known as the oval thyrsin, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal and inland areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and clustered in a cylindrical shape. Thyrsanthema ovalis is often found in open habitats and is adapted to withstand coastal conditions.
